bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: George III (George William Frederick; 4 June 1738[1] – 29 January 1820 [N.S.]) was King of Great Britain and King of Ireland from 25 October 1759 until 1 January 1801, and thereafter of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland until his death. He was concurrently Duke of Brunswick-Lüneburg (Hanover), and thus Archtreasurer and Prince-Elector of the Holy Roman Empire, and later King of Hanover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Appointment of William Horne as ensign in the 63rd regiment of foot by King George III.
